issues.title: Search as you type is too aggresive
issues.body:
Search as you type in the default search box starts searching for documents from the first character which results in higher App and ElasticSearch use with questionable gains. 

Change the code so that it requires at least X number of characters to be typed and/or increase the wait time between the last pressed key to start of the search. Ideally make those variables configurable in the settings so we can experiment to find the best UX / Infra cost fraction.

Needed for the k8s deployment.

issues.title: Search Architecture
issues.body:
* Kitsune uses ElasticSearch v2.4
* On AWS Kitsune will run on multiple regions
* ElasticSearch data don't have to be persistent and can be regenerated completely from database.

## Architecture (second iteration)

Our elastic search provider (elastic.co) creates instances with public IPs. Therefore instead of having the region local App instances update only the region local ES instance and signal the other App regions to do the same, each App instance can directly update all ES instances.

The update of ES each triggered by Django's `post_save` signals, so for example 

**when a new Document gets saved in Frankfurt**
 1. Kitsune Fra connects to RDS Oregon and saves the doc in database
 2. Kitsune Fra creates 3 Celery jobs to update that document in ES indices, one for ES running in Fra, one for ES in Oregon and one for ES in Tokyo.

issues.title: Database Architecture
issues.body:
- Kitsune uses MySQL (See #2937) on SCL3.
 - On AWS Kitsune will running in multiple regions
 - Since all visitors can potentially write on the database (from the simple task to subscribe to a question to the more complex editing and managing of KB articles), we can't have an admin only domain as we do with other apps. We want visitors on `support.mozilla.org` to be able to write to database and thus we need a database solution which supports writes from multiple locations. 
 - Recently AWS announced Aurora Multi Master support. Aurora is MySQL compatible so we could "just switch" with the downside of getting more locked-in into AWS.  Either way Aurora only supports multi-AZ Multi Master at the moment (2018-01-15) with a plan to support multi-Region in the future. We can re-eval when multi-Region becomes available but for the time being we need an alternative plan.

## Suggested Database Architecture:

 - Replication in RDS using MariaDB is known to work well. 
 - The Arch defines:
   - A DB in **Oregon** as the **Master** database
   - Databases in  **other regions** (currently Frankfurt and Tokyo) as **Read Replicants** of the Master database
 - Kitsune instances in **all regions** use [django-multidb-router](https://github.com/jbalogh/django-multidb-router) in **Pinning Mode** to route write db operations to **Oregon** while read operations get routed to the nearest Read Replica.
 - We need a secure tunnel between Oregon and other regions, using Inter-Region VPC Peering where supported or other method where not supported.

![prod after](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/584352/34943770-bc5a3e8a-fa05-11e7-9ed8-1b8667413846.jpg)


### Pre AWS Migration - Development Architecture

 - To develop and test the architecture we want to setup a minimal version with a Master Database in Oregon and a Read Replica in Frankfurt.
 - The Master Database will get populated with a recent anonymized SQL dump. Ideally we want to copy what we have now in `sumo-dev` database in Frankfurt.
 - The secure tunnel between Frankfurt and Oregon needs to be established
 - After completing AWS migration this infra will be shutdown and Kitsune dev instances will switch to using the RDS instances defined in the next section.

![dev](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/584352/34943422-42843f12-fa04-11e7-9a40-f2b71efa877a.jpg)
 

### Pre AWS Migration - Production and Staging Architecture
 
 - SUMO database in big and takes some time to get imported #2993 
 - To reduce the time needed to migrate from SCL3 to AWS we're working on getting Data Replication going between the two datacenters #3006 
 - The Arch defines:
   - An RDS instance in Oregon which acts as Read Replica of SCL3
   - Two RDS instances in Frankfurt and Tokyo that act as Read Replicas of Oregon Read Replica
 - When it's time to flip the switch to AWS, Oregon will become Master and the other DBs will remain Read Replicas
 - Bonus points if we setup SCL3 to become Read Replica of AWS,  as a fallback plan.
 - We want to setup all three DBs (Oregon, Fra, Tokyo) from now so we can host a Read Only version of the site as soon as possible.
 - We also want to setup the tunnel  between Fra, Tokyo and Oregon asap, so it's ready to accept connections when Oregon becomes master.

![prod](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/584352/34944035-b0388296-fa06-11e7-81e3-71445bf850a3.jpg)

Questions:
 - Can we use MariaDB over MySQL and still get replication from SCL3 to AWS to work?
 - How we setup the tunnel between the Regions?
 
What do you think @mozilla/sumo ?

issues.title: Test READ_ONLY Mode of Kitsune in SCL3 and AWS
issues.body:
Kitsune sports a READ_ONLY mode. Test and verify that it's working as advertised. 

This will be used during the migration:

 - Both SCL3 and AWS will be switched to READ_ONLY
 - Gradually we'll shift the traffic to AWS.
 - After AWS stabilizes we'll enable writes again

- [ ] Verify that READ_ONLY in SCL3 works
- [ ] Verify that READ_ONLY in AWS works

 - Re-enable test #2963 
 - Switch to cached_db sessions

issues.title: Switch user media to s3 + CDN on SCL3
issues.body:
We want to convert legacy codebase running on SCL3 to use S3.

See also #2899 

Deployment for staging
- [x] Rsync user media to S3 (see #2948)
- [x] Backup virtualenv and settings_local.py
- [x] Update settings_local.py
- [x] Chief push
- [x] Verify that uploads and resizing work by uploading to https://support.allizom.org/en-US/gallery/images
- [x] Verify that media CDN works
- [x] Update `Document.html` (see snippet bellow) to get the new cdn urls.
- [x] Re-run rsync to make sure that we didn't miss any uploads meanwhile

Deployment for prod
- [x] Rsync user media to S3 (see #2948)
- [x] Backup virtualenv and settings_local.py
- [x] Update settings_local.py
- [x] Chief push
- [x] Verify that uploads and resizing work by uploading to https://support.allizom.org/en-US/gallery/images
- [x] Verify that media CDN works
- [x] Update `Document.html` (see snippet bellow) to get the new cdn urls.
- [x] Re-run rsync to make sure that we didn't miss any uploads meanwhile

Note that the current CDN (support.cdn.mozilla.net) serves both user media and static media and should remain active until we complete the prod migration. We *must not* make any changes to the current CDN meanwhile.

Env Variables to update
```
    AWS_S3_CUSTOM_DOMAIN
    AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID
    AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
    AWS_STORAGE_BUCKET_NAME
    AWS_S3_HOST
    MEDIA_URL
```

issues.title: Calculate time needed to restore production database
issues.body:
The production database is a large (~100Gb). We need to calculate the time needed to restore it in the real database engine that's going to be used in AWS.

If the time needed is above the threshold considered acceptable to do the move we should investigate other options, like incremental import of data. 

A dev import into a `db.t2.small` instance took about 30 hours. FTR the complete lithium migration took about 48 hours.

issues.title: Improve Travis Build Time
issues.body:
Travis needs 15-20 minutes to complete testing a pull request. We need to improve this time to iterate faster.

Half of the time is spend re-building the image. Current docker version in Travis (17.03) does not support the `cache_from` directive in `docker-compose.yml` so we need to find another way to use pre-built docker images

issues.title: Fix search related tests
issues.body:
The ElasticSearch upgrade to V2 broke a number of tests.

Currently all search related tests are marked as `search_tests` and get skipped in the test runs with `-a '!search_tests'`.

This issue tracks the update / re-write of those tests to work with current infra.

See also #2931

issues.title: Evaluate the removal of ZenDesk code and tests
issues.body: Kitsune has ZenDesk related code which is very possible to be deprecated. Evaluate it's usefulness and remove if not used.

issues.title: Remove TokenLogin Backend and Middleware
issues.body:
In `settings.py` there's a [TokenLogin backend](https://github.com/mozilla/kitsune/blob/master/kitsune/settings.py#L516) in addition to the Model Backend for authetication. It appears that since [bug 921480](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=921480) are not using this in production. According to the bug this was somehow related to Persona Authentication.

Since this is not in use in production, we don't need to have the code laying around. I'll remove from default settings and this issue tracks it's removal from code.

issues.title: Rsync user media from SCL to S3
Switch Celery Broker to Redis
issues.body:
Currently we use RabbitMQ as the Celery broker. Celery officially supports Redis too which makes more sense to use since we already have a running Redis instance.

Redis need to be configured to not evict any keys from the Celery database so we don't have missing jobs.

issues.title: Confirm that django-axes gets client's ip
issues.body:
django-axes needs to now the client ip. Now it's configurated to `HTTP_X_CLUSTER_CLIENT_IP`. 

Does this header work in k8s?

issues.title: Decide on the Database
issues.body:
Current database on SCL3

 - MySQL 5.6.33-log

We should investigate the existence of raw SQL queries in the codebase or in libraries (especially django-tidings) before deciding on the Engine type and version.

issues.title: Add support for Auth0
issues.body:
Currently SUMO locks `/admin` behind Auth0 and SSO on the webserver level. 

Use [mozilla-django-iodc](https://github.com/mozilla/mozilla-django-oidc/) to move the authentication on the App level.

issues.title: Fix unit tests.
issues.body:
Current unit test suite is broken. Fix it.

Update: We excluded a few tests from the test suite and it now completes successfully. An issue must be created for each (group of) test(s) which have been excluded and it should be linked to this tracker issue.

issues.title: Meta Issue For Docker Install On Mac
issues.body:
Parking lot for issues I am having getting the install running on mac.

### docker-compose Version Not Supported
3.4 does not appear to be supported by the version of docker I have installed (Version 17.09.0-ce-mac35, no update available). 3.3 does work

### Missing Install Docs
We don't have install docs for docker.

### What I have done thus far...
1. Change version in docker-compose file to 3.3
2. Run ```docker-compose up``` 
3. Made and drank a cup of tea.
4. Copy ```.env-dist``` to ```.env```
5. docker exec into kitsune container and run the following:
    - ```./manage.py migrate```
    - ```./manage.py createsuperuser```
    - ```./manage.py generatedata```

After the above got errors for all static content, example ```web_1            | ValueError: The file 'build/common-min.js' could not be found with <kitsune.sumo.storage.SumoFilesStorage object at 0x7f3471785fd0>.```

Tried running collect static within container.. generates error ```AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'strip'```

Stuck here for now, also tried this on my linode Linux machine..ran into the same problems.

issues.title: Setup prod hosting of static media for AWS prod
issues.body:
For dev we'll probably just serve static media from the primary docker container via [whitenoise](http://whitenoise.evans.io/en/stable/), but that won't scale to prod traffic. We have some options:

* Sync static files to S3 and serve via a CDN
* Deploy a separate Nginx container for serving said files, optionally with a CDN in front
* Put a CDN in front of the entire site (potentially a lot more work)

review_comments.body: Bah.  Yes, I can remove that.

James: Are localizations tested and/or verified to have correct Python string expansion stuff in them?  For Miro, I ended up writing a wrapper for gettext, so that it would catch KeyErrors and TypeErrors (what gets thrown when the string being expanded is borked) and return the English version of the string.  If localizations are tested/verified, then this isn't an issue.

The localization docs suggest to use the new string formatting method with labels instead of positionals.  e.g:

```
_("Invalid option: {optionname}").format(optionname=value.value)
```

Things I noticed immediately:
- `/contributors` can't ever crash. Right now it fails if the correct Redis backend isn't there. It can't crash then, or if the Redis server is unavailable, or if the data is gone or bad, or...
- The cron should warn you if the redis backend is undefined, or redis is down, or... That one should crash, usefully and loudly.
- Things need to be much prettier if the data is unavailable. In any of those "don't crash" situations, or whatever, we should either hide the "unhelpful" section or show something else.

Or SkipTest.

So, bleach is probably not the right choice here, for a couple reasons.
- HTML sanitizing is generally something that should be done at, or closer to, output. We sanitize the wiki content before we stick it into `Document.html` because that's a caching mechanism to keep the pre-rendered HTML around. But in general, we don't know that the destination is HTML, so saving content sanitized for a specific output doesn't make sense. Keeping HTML sanitization closer to output also keeps things consistent for security reviewers.
- We only need to use `bleach.clean` if we _want_ to allow a subset of HTML. That isn't something we should generally assume: if we find a case where that _is_ necessary, we should be explicit about it, since we'll have to use `|safe` to render that, anyway.
- Bleach doesn't actually _validate_ anything--it sanitizes it. Django is a bit weird, using `clean` for the name of the method from which you throw `ValidationError` but we're really talking about validation here. The next couple of lines _do_ validate the value for the select/radio type, but we also need to validate and coerce for the checkbox (boolean) type.

It would be interesting to do a little magic for coercing `value` into a boolean when we're talking about the `checkbox` type. A couple options are:
- _Really magic_--name the property `_value` and set `db_column='value'`, then make `value` a getter/setter with `property`.
- _Not so magic_, but kind of Java-ish--add `get_value()` and `set_value()` methods.

I kind of hate explicit getters and setters, so I lean toward the more magic version.
